meanings.definition: To convert (a military organization or activity) to civilian control or use.
meanings.sent1: The government is civilianizing the military base, so it will be run by civilians instead of soldiers.
meanings.sent2: The process of civilianizing the army took several years to complete.
meanings.sent3: After civilianizing the military base, the soldiers had to find new jobs in the civilian world.
meanings.sent4: The idea of civilianizing the military seemed like a daunting task at first.
meanings.sent5: Civilianizing the military meant a shift in power from the military to civilians.

meanings.definition: To make (someone) adopt civilian habits or characteristics.
meanings.sent1: The program focuses on civilianizing veterans to help them transition back to civilian life.
meanings.sent2: She is civilianizing her son by teaching him about civilian responsibilities.
meanings.sent3: Civilianizing the new recruit involved teaching him how to dress appropriately for civilian events.
meanings.sent4: The process of civilianizing the young soldier was challenging but rewarding.
meanings.sent5: He is civilianizing his behavior to fit in better with his civilian friends.
